meaningMnemonic:
You know that 付ける means "to attach" and that 見 means "see." So, when you attach your seeing to something, it's like you're looking around trying <vocabulary>to find</vocabulary> something. When you find what you're looking for, imagine your eyeballs flying out and attaching to that item, then yelling "I FOUND IT!"

You'll usually see this word with the 付 in kana, so 見つける.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from 見る and 付ける. If you use those readings, you'll be able to read this word too.
